content: I think we should filter some issues that we are opening in Zulip
in particular ...
https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/245100-t-compiler.2Fwg-prioritization.2Falerts/topic/I-prioritize.20.2375588.20Missing.20Implementors.20for.20traits
that one is for T-rustdoc so we don't really want to have a topic opened for us
what we want is T-compiler and I-prioritize or I-prioritize without a team (just in case is for T-compiler and wasn't properly labelled)
ok, so it the relevant team is added in a second moment after the I-prioritize label , can we then remove the I-prioritize label and leave only the label of the team, right?
@apiraino ohh sorry, that's not what I meant, let me explain this better
first of all both team labels and I-prioritize label are independent of each other, I meant, having T-compiler or T-libs on an issue has nothing to do with having I-prioritize in it
both means different things and are independent
what I meant about triagebot is that there are some issues right now
one (that I didn't mention above) is that if I-prioritize is added before T-compiler, and then T-compiler is added (if I remember correctly) a Zulip topic is not opened
this could be fixed or after T-compiler was added we can manually remove I-prioritize and re-add it
the other issue, the one I was mentioning above is that the working group is about prioritizing T-compiler and libs-impl stuff, not T-rustdoc or others' team things

so ... what I meant is that we can make triagebot only open a zulip topic if the given issues that was requested prioritization (someone added I-prioritize to it) already have T-compiler or libs-impl in it
or well, or do not have any team, so no T-rustdoc, T-infra, T-core, T-lang, T-libs
issues without team, may be ours or may be not, but very likely it's T-compiler given that most are T-compiler :)

Santiago Pastorino said:

the other issue, the one I was mentioning above is that the working group is about prioritizing T-compiler and libs-impl stuff, not T-rustdoc or others' team things

is anyone in charge of prioritizing rustdoc? the rustdoc team certainly hasn't been lol

Joshua Nelson said:

Santiago Pastorino said:

the other issue, the one I was mentioning above is that the working group is about prioritizing T-compiler and libs-impl stuff, not T-rustdoc or others' team things

is anyone in charge of prioritizing rustdoc? the rustdoc team certainly hasn't been lol

no idea but we can all feel free to try to help everywhere, it's just that the focus of the wg is more about compiler issues and not the rest
but of course we can all help :)
@Joshua Nelson not every team requires prioritisation efforts, and for most of the others, nomination directly works fine.
rustdoc doesn't do weekly meeting though
so I-nominated does nothing
I'm not saying this team specifically needs to deal with it, but there should be some plan other than "ignore it"
ok, I asked the rustdoc team and they requested that wg-prioritization marks any regression as P-high (maybe automatically?) and ping the team
Good to know :+1:

Joshua Nelson said:

ok, I asked the rustdoc team and they requested that wg-prioritization marks any regression as P-high (maybe automatically?) and ping the team

I am ok with that. thanks @Joshua Nelson for relaying this question to them and sorting an actionable out of it
ye that's what I normally do with rustdoc nominated issues :stuck_out_tongue:
